intro: Chalcoelytrum nutans, commonly known as the nodding chalcoelytrum, is a member of the Aizoaceae family, native to southern Africa. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-white flowers that droop downward, giving it its common name. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Chalcoelytrum nutans is valued for its ornamental appeal and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
